intro: Lagopsis marrubiastrum var. tschuensis, commonly known as the Chinese hoary bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
